title: Portrait of Mr. J. Willis Dalzell
credit_line: J. Willis Dalzell Memorial Collection, bequest of Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell
provenance_text:
George Rufus Boynton [1854-1945], New York, NY [1]; Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell (Mary Beer Dalzell) [1844-1929], Pittsburgh, PA until February 13, 1929; Mary B. Dalzell estate, February 1929; bequest to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1929 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Sources differ regarding the artist's birth date, given in various years between 1854 and 1868. Though a note in the curatorial file indicates that the 1868 date was confirmed by the artist, the earliest date appears more consistent (see curatorial file.) 
[2]. The painting was collected from Mrs. Dalzell's residence on Ridge Avenue in Pittsburgh and brought to Carnegie Institute on February 19, 1929. It was accessioned on February 25, 1929.
